name: Frequency - Not less than 2 weeks prior the commencement of the demolition

Acceptance Criteria - Dilapidation Report for all existing roads and tracks and any other areas utilised by the Contractor for the construction of the Works proposed for use by the Contractor in execution of the Works prior to commencement of physical works on site
Record of conformity - Submission of Dilapidation Report
Frequency - Not more than three weeks after the award of the Contract
Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor must submit a methodology statement describing all activities required for site establishment to the Contract Administrator for approval
Record of conformity - Submission of Site Establishment Methodology Statement

Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor is responsible for installation (and removal) of the metered water supply point, the supply of the meter and arranging for the reading of the meter, and submission of the readings, monthly. The Contractor must arrange for the Contract Administrator to be present for the initial and final readings.
Record of conformity - Picture or formal notification
Frequency - Prior to bringing any on to the site

Acceptance Criteria - List of each item of plant, equipment and tools to be used in the Works including type, maker, details of general configuration, weight, maximum wheel load, tyre pressure and maximum height
Frequency - Not less than 1 week prior to commencing removal

Acceptance Criteria - When the Contractor's compound is no longer required for the Works being constructed under the Contract, the Contractor must remove from the compound area all sacrificial crushed rock layers and geotextile liners from the Contractor's compound.
Frequency - Prior to commencing asphalt works

Acceptance Criteria - Details of the location of proposed stockpile sites specifying the maximum dimensions (including height) of the proposed stockpile, material(s) to be stockpiled, proposed separation of stockpiles and methods of management of material(s) to be stockpiled
Frequency - Prior to commencing asphalt works
Acceptance Criteria - The location of a temporary stockpile of cold planed asphalt must be proposed by the Contractor and approved by the Contract Administrator.

Acceptance Criteria - At the conclusion of the Works, the Contractor must dispose of surplus stockpiled material off-site and return the stockpile area to a condition similar to that which it was found, including regrading, replacement of topsoil and establishing grass to the satisfaction of the Contract Administrator.
Frequency - Prior to commencement of works
Acceptance Criteria - Submission of Details and credentials of Project Quality Representative
Frequency - Prior to commencement of works
Acceptance Criteria - Submission of Draft and final Project Quality Plan
Frequency - Within 24 hours of implementing the change

Acceptance Criteria - Changes to the Quality System may be made by the Contractor at any time. Such changes must comply with the requirements of the specification and must be subject to the prior written approval by the Contract Administrator.
Frequency - Before the commencement of work
Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor must submit and finalise a Construction Environmental Management Plan (CEMP) in accordance with the requirements of the Contract.
Frequency - within five (5) working days after receipt of a notice for non- compliance.

Acceptance Criteria - Submission of a written report to the Contract Administrator describing corrective actions required as a result of a non-compliance with the CEMP within five (5) working days after receipt of a notice for non-compliance.
Acceptance Criteria - Lot conforms to all required Technical Specifications. Any NCR's actioned and closed out and no further actions are required.
Record of conformity - ITP Sign Off
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
1.1 - Supply of paints for pavement marking.
Frequency - Not less than 1 month prior to the commencement of pavement marking.
Acceptance Criteria - Submission of conformance test reports for the proposed paints to the Contract Administrator which demonstrate compliance to Section 2 of this ITP.
2.1 - Runway marking paint and taxiway and apron marking paint type and packaging
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of pavement marking works.

Acceptance Criteria - Paint is pre-mixed acrylic co-polymer water-based paint, packaged in 20 L containers. Containers are of durable construction and labelled with manufacturer's name and a complete description of the contents. Paint is of a consistency suitable for application by brushing and spraying, and capable of being used as supplied or diluted with water.
○ Dilution information and coverage is stated by the manufacturer on the packaging.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractors Quality Representat ive
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of pavement marking works, at the time of delivery of paint.
Acceptance Criteria - Hand stirring of the paint readily produces a smooth uniform product.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of pavement marking works.
Acceptance Criteria - The dried surface of painted areas on aircraft aprons is not slippery under foot. The surface finish of the dried film of paint is a non-gloss matte finish.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
3.0 - Demonstration of process and equipment for removal of pavement paint markings.
Frequency - Not less than 1 working day prior to the commencement of full-scale paint removal works. Prior notice (24 hours minimum) of trial to be given to Contract Administrator.

Acceptance Criteria - A trial conducted in an area agreed with the Contract Administrator of not less than 5 m2 demonstrates removal of pavement marking without chemical methods, without causing disintegration of the pavement surface and in compliance with the requirements of Section 4 of this ITP.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contract Administrato r
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of paint marking removal work in each work period.

Acceptance Criteria - All plant is in working order, free from leaks, and capable of removing all paint from the pavement surface without filling voids with debris, removing joint sealants or otherwise damaging the pavement surface.
Record of conformity - Daily Plant Verification Checklist
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of paint marking removal work in each work period.

Acceptance Criteria - Pavement surface is free of snow, ice or slush, with a surface temperature of at least 5oC and rising at the beginning of operations (except for where shot- or sand- blasting is used for which a lower surface temperature may be accepted). Work is not occurring during a thunderstorm. Work is not occurring during rainfall, except for water-blasting and removal of previously applied chemicals.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractors Quality representati ve
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of paint marking removal work in each work period.
Acceptance Criteria - The surface texture of the cleaned removal area is comparable to a standard area of pavement in the removal trial area selected by the Contract Administrator.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractors Quality representati ve
Frequency - At the completion of paint marking removal work in each work period.
Acceptance Criteria - Debris and waste materials have been collected, removed from site and disposed of at an appropriately licensed waste disposal site.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractors Quality representati ve
Frequency - At the completion of setting out and prior to application of pavement markings. Prior notice (minimum 24 hours) of commencement of setting out is given to the Contract Administrator.

Acceptance Criteria - Survey for setting out new pavement markings has been completed as shown on the Drawings by a suitably qualified surveyor, to a horizontal accuracy of ± 25 mm. Spotting indicates the location and extent of new markings in sufficient detail for the painting of the required markings to the tolerances specified.
Inspection/Test Method - Inspection / Statement of complianc e by contractor s PQR
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed by Contract Administrato r
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of pavement marking in each work period. Prior notice (minimum 24 hours) of the commencement of pavement marking is given to the Contract Administrator.

Acceptance Criteria - The surface to be painted has been thoroughly cleaned using vacuum sweepers, hand brooming, and/or high pressure water jetting as required, and all existing paint not strongly adhering to the pavement has been removed.
Inspection/Test Method - Inspection / Statement of Complianc e by Contractor s PQR
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed by Contract Administrato r
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of pavement marking in each work period.

Acceptance Criteria - The pavement surface is not wet and wet weather conditions are unlikely during the work period, the air and pavement temperatures are not less than 15oC, the relative humidity is not greater than 85%, the wind speed is not greater than 20km/hr, and wind conditions are unlikely to affect the application of the paint.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed by Contract Administrato r
5.4 - Pavement marking adjacent to in- pavement light fittings

Acceptance Criteria - Any in-pavement light fittings in the vicinity of pavement marking works have been protected to avoid contamination with paint. Markings in line with light fittings extend to the edge of the fitting but not on to the fitting. The gap between the end of painted line and edge of a light fitting is not more than 25 mm.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor Quality representati ve

Acceptance Criteria - Paint is applied by spraying, except for small markings, isolated repairs, and stencilling of letters and numerals where brushing is permitted. Paint is applied in 2 even coats to give a minimum total dry film thickness of 120 µm. The edges of markings are straight or smooth even curves, with crisp even lines without side spatter at the edges and ends of markings.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor Quality representati ve

Acceptance Criteria - Glass beads are not used on any pavements with the exception of areas specified within standard MAS- CVL-002 for Pavement & Pavement Markings (Airside). Where glass beads are specified on taxiway pavement markings, the minimum application rate is 300 g/m2.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contractor Quality representati ve
Frequency - At the completion of paint marking removal work in each work period.
Acceptance Criteria - Paint usage and area of coverage for each work period are recorded.
Record of conformity - Daily Shift Report.
5.8 - Daily records of Paint Usage and Area covered.
Acceptance Criteria - Daily records of paint usage and the area covered must be maintained by the Contractor to ensure that the specified application rate of the paint is being achieved consistently.
Inspection/Test Method - Review of Daily Records.
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed by Contractors Quality representati ve.
5.9 - Removal of Non- conforming Pavement markings

Acceptance Criteria - Any pavement markings that do not comply with the requirements of this Specification must be deemed non- conforming and must be removed by the contractor in accordance with the requirements of Clause 7104 and reinstated.
Inspection/Test Method - Verificatio n of Removal
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed by Contract Administrat or
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
1.0 - Preliminary Activities – Permits, Documentation, Approvals, Survey Documentation
Frequency - Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria - Current revision drawing is being used including the Subcontractor’s copy.
○ Current revision to be obtained via Aconex.
Reference Documents - Drawings and drawing registers on Aconex
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by contractors Quality Represent ative.
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Frequency - Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS, WP
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by contractors Quality Represent ative.
Frequency - Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria - Work area has been cleared and limits of works defined on site.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by contractors Quality Represent ative.
Acceptance Criteria - List of all plant, equipment and tools to Contract Administrator prior to commencement of Works.
Record of conformity - List of all plant equipment and tools to be submitted to Contract administrator.
2.2 - Stabilised Calibration and demonstration of spraying equipment
Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor must demonstrate to the Contract Administrator prior to the commencement of work that the spraying equipment complies with the Specifications.
Record of conformity - Aconex Submissio n/This ITP signed by Contract administrator.
Frequency - 24 hours prior to commencement of works
Acceptance Criteria - Written intention to proceed with the Works and on what basis this decision has been made, at least 24 hours prior to commencement of works.
○ Application of the rejuvenation material must only proceed when the pavement temperature is above 15 °C and rising.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by contractors Quality Represent ative.
Frequency - 24hours notice prior to commencement of works
Acceptance Criteria - 24 hours’ notice to the Contract Administrator for inspection of the surface to be rejuvenated.
○ Prior to applying the Rejuvenating Material, the Contractor must prepare the pavements surface. This preparation may include but not be limited to:
— Sweeping those areas of the surface contaminated with accumulations of soil, silt or other foreign and/or loose material.
— Protecting all airfield light fittings and other structures and abutting concrete by suitable means.
— Protecting all pavement markings by suitable means unless stated otherwise on the drawings.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by all parties present including contractors administrator
5.1 - Transport and Storage of Rejuvenating material to site
Frequency - 7 days prior to transporting rejuvenating material to site
Acceptance Criteria - During construction, the contractor must submit records on the transport and storage of the material on request by the Contract Administrator.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by contractors administrator
Frequency - 24hours notice prior to commencement of works

Acceptance Criteria - The Rejuvenating Material must be applied only in the presence of the Contract Administrator. Rejuvenating Material must only be applied using a suitably calibrated sprayer/applicator.
○ Before each run is applied, the Contractor must mark out the pavement with removable markings to guide the sprayer when applying the Rejuvenating Material to ensure correct application.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by all parties present including contractors administrator
Acceptance Criteria - The Rejuvenating Material must be applied at the application rates indicated as per the specification.
○ Application rates will be included in daily record sheets.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contract administrator / Daily Spray Record Sheets
6.1 - Application of fuel resistant surface treatment
Frequency - Prior to commencement of works
Acceptance Criteria - Proposed production and process control testing programme.
Record of conformity - Aconex Submissio n of PQP / This ITP signed by Contract administrator
Acceptance Criteria - Reference samples, test certificates, MSDS and technical data as specified for component materials and previous usage of the Rejuvenating Material and sand
Record of conformity - Test Certificate s / Reference Samples / This ITP signed by Contract administrator
Frequency - Prior to commencement of works

Acceptance Criteria - The Contractor’s work method statement for the processes to be used for the application of the Rejuvenating Material, including surface cleaning/preparation, priming (as required), number of coats to be applied and curing time must be submitted with the reference samples.
Record of conformity - Aconex Submissio n / Reference samples / This ITP signed by Contract administrator
Acceptance Criteria - Submit detailed information for each shift. Details include application rate, location, test certificates and daily spray records etc.
Inspection/Test Method - Review of Lot Submissio n details
Record of conformity - Lot Submissio n document s submitted to Contract administrator
Acceptance Criteria - Non-conforming materials or areas must be repaired or rectified by the contractor to comply fully with the specification.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed by Contract administrator
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
